I spent three nights in Barcelona and had a late dinner here all three nights.  Les Tapes was the closest bar to where I was staying in Barri Gotic. Some of these tiny bars can seem intimidating for the non-Spanish speaking tourist--full of men or full or locals.  However, at around 9pm, it was still a bit empty and there was a little old lady and a couple at the bar so I thought I'd take my chances. I tried to order in Spanish but I must have botched it because the owner switched to English. The little old lady was 91 and had moved to Spain from NYC 30 years ago.  She said that the owner was one of the best cooks in town.  She also said she liked Les Tapes because it wasn't a pick-up bar--hilarious!  Another  regular said it was an known ex-pat bar so English speakers feel comfortable.  Everything I had here was delicious, hearty, home-style comfort food.  Prices are incredible.  I typically had 2 glasses of house vino tinto + a full meal for under 10 euros.  Friendly staff and friendly locals.  The bar didn't stay empty for long.  By 10pm, the tiny place was standing-room only, especially on a game night.
